channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: National intel chief Tulsi Gabbard strips security clearances from 37 current and former officials
item.description: President Trump's intelligence director is revoking the security clearances of more than three dozen former and current officials on claims they "abus...

item.title: Abrego Garcia seeks dismissal of criminal charges, citing 'vindictive prosecution'
item.description: Kilmar Abrego Garcia is asking a federal judge in Tennessee to dismiss human trafficking charges against him as "vindictive prosecution" by the Trump ...

item.title: Exclusive: New Report Shows Red State Institutions Are Just As Left-Wing As Their Blue Counterparts
item.description: 'Without aggressive institutional reform and principled policymaking, [red states] will follow the same trajectory as their blue peers.'

item.title: Chris Coons’ Crocodile Tears Over Judicial Nominations Are Pure Hypocrisy
item.description: Senate Republicans should ignore Coons complaints against the White House.

item.title: The American Academy Of Pediatrics Keeps Proving Itself To Be An Anti-Science Cult
item.description: If you thought the left-wing American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) couldn’t do any more to discredit itself as a legitimate medical organization, think...

item.title: Prediction markets show Trump with good chance of snagging Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: President Trump has a good chance of winning the Nobel Peace Prize in 2025, according to bettors on two of the most popular prediction platforms.

item.title: D.C.’s Murder Rate Is More Than 500% Higher Than The Average State
item.description: D.C.’s murder rate ran 169 percent higher than Louisiana’s, the deadliest state, and an astonishing 523 percent higher than that of the average state.

item.title: Irish Too Good to Serve Each Other
item.description: What would it mean as a policy for Irish people to expect that the bottom 10 percent of jobs be taken up by immigrants?

item.title: Rabid Leftist Arrested For Threatening To Kill Trump And Major Media Refuse To Cover It
item.description: The threat of homicide is more sobering considering Trump was nearly assassinated twice last year.

item.title: Trump’s Just War Against University Antisemitism Can Go Too Far
item.description: The Trump administration’s case against UCLA shows the danger of hostile environment claims.

item.title: Trump weighs in on mine deal that would give copper control to company with Chinese ties
item.description: President Trump on Tuesday blasted an appeals court's ruling temporarily blocking the transfer of an Arizona copper mine that has been heavily critici...

item.title: Suspended Time: A Privileged History of Covid
item.description: Gatekeepers and the media elite sentimentalize the memory of the lockdowns.

item.title: The Return of Car Choice, Hopefully
item.description: Whatever happens to the future of EVs, they should compete on an even playing field with other vehicles.

item.title: Trump targets 'woke' habits of Smithsonian museums

item.title: Trump Has No Power to Tell States How to Conduct Elections
item.description: While Congress may override state election regulations, the president has no such power.
